main.name: Zachary Knopp
main.description: I'm a creator who is fascinated by motion. I think agile robotics will pave the way to adaptable automation and I want to be one of the people driving it.
main.bio: I like transforming ideas into tangible creations. For my masterâ€™s thesis, I built computer vision algorithms to reduce waste in industrial potato peeling processes. I have also developed several robotic platforms for controls research. Lately, I have been building scalable web applications that enable businesses to make data-driven management decisions.

education.degree: Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering
education.description: I was given the opportunity to explore my interests, which led me to performing research in computer vision and robotics. My thesis work involved creating computer vision algorithms for reducing waste in industrial potato peeling processes. Also during my degree, I received an NSERC award, I wrote three conference papers, acted as a teaching assistant for multiple courses, and built a two-wheeled, inverted pendulum robot from the ground up.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering
education.description: At the start of my degree, I joined the varsity soccer team and we won our division, which sent us to nationals. Then I started running on the track team and I became a CIS Academic All-Canadian. I also spent some time working on the Formula SAE team, although we never got to competition. In my fourth year, I became a research assistant for Dr. Rickey Dubay, who mentored my senior design team as we built a pick-and-place robotic arm.

work.title: Senior Software Engineer
work.description: At Symplicity, I developed an application that enables businesses to make data-driven management decisions. Duties included deciding on the tech stacks, designing the UI/UX and building the database, server and client layers.

work.title: Software Developer
work.description: At Cold Furnace Studios, I assembled a playable demo as the foundation for a AAA video game. I also developed coding standards, naming conventions and branching strategies so the project would be maintainable.

work.title: R&D Engineering Intern
work.description: At Kendrion, I designed several production tools. Work included realizing the problem, planning a concept, building SolidWorks models, creating detailed engineering drawings and communicating with technicians to ensure proper construction.

resume.skillmessage: I like to tinker with things, learning as I go. These are some of the skills and technologies that have stuck with me.

skills.skills: Electromechanical design, control law derivation, system identification, predictive control, computer vision algorithm development, troubleshooting robotic systems, UI/UX, app development.

projects.title: Potato Peeling
projects.category: Developed algorithms to analyze peeled potatos as a first step towards closed-loop control of an industrial potato peeler.

projects.title: Two-Wheeled Bot
projects.category: Designed and built a two-wheeled inverted pendulum robot as a test bed for nonlinear controllers.

projects.title: Visual Control of a Robotic Arm
projects.category: Controlled a robotic arm using a camera to overcome the negative effects of backlash.

projects.title: Haptic Maze
projects.category: Investigated how people learn through touch, using a force feedback maze.

projects.title: 2.5DOF Manipulator
projects.category: Designed, fabricated and controlled a 2DOF robotic manipulator with a pneumatic gripper.

projects.title: Wall-Following Robot
projects.category: Created a simple wall-following robot for ECE4333.
